sprawl
  • Reference

pBuffer

Create a SpatialPolygons* object expanding a SpatialPoints* with single buffers. The new geometries are rectangles or circles which maintain the original associated data.frame, if present. The width/weight or radius of the buffers are directly provided to the function of taken from a sample Raster* / SpatialGrid* / SpatialPixels* object (see details).

pBuffer(points, res, res_scale = 1, quadsegs = 5, ...)

Arguments

points

A SpatialPoints or SpatialPointsDataFrame object, including the points to be buffered.
res

A numeric vector of length 1 or 2, containing the radius of the circular buffers (if 1-length vector) or the width and height of the rectangle (if 2-length). Alternatively, also a Raster* / SpatialGrid* / SpatialPixels* is accepted: in this case, the raster resolution is used as width/height of the rectangular buffers.
res_scale

(optional) Numeric scaling factor of the resolution (useful in the case res is a raster object).
quadsegs

(optional) Number of line segments to use to approximate a quarter circle (in case of circular buffer).
...

other arguments

Value

An object of class SpatialPolygons or SpatialPolygonsDataFrame, depending on the specific geometry which is read.

Note

License: GPL 3.0

Examples

# Load sample data
r <- raster::raster(system.file("extdata","testrast.tif", package = "sprawl"))
p <- sp::spsample(as(r, "SpatialPixels"), 20, "random")

# Rectangular buffer (3x3 cells)
pBuffer(p, r, 3)
#> class       : SpatialPolygons 
#> features    : 20 
#> extent      : 12900971, 12965906, 1697841, 1789752  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax)
#> coord. ref. : NA 

# Squared buffer (100x100 metres)
pBuffer(p, c(100,100))
#> class       : SpatialPolygons 
#> features    : 20 
#> extent      : 12901268, 12965608, 1698139, 1789455  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax)
#> coord. ref. : NA 

# Circular buffer (radius = 50 metres)
pBuffer(p, 50)
#> class       : SpatialPolygons 
#> features    : 20 
#> extent      : 12901268, 12965608, 1698139, 1789455  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax)
#> coord. ref. : NA
